page.title: 19Knockholt and its Services
page.content: Knockholt shares a Rector with a neighbouring village, Halstead. This is a new innovation and initially was not popular but is now working well. It is a very caring and public -spirited village. Some years ago Knockholt fought to be allowed to stay in the Sevenoak district instead of becoming part of Bromley and Greater London. Thousands of pounds were raised and eventually Knockholt was allowed to have its way and remain a country village instead of becoming part of London's overspill. The village also fought against planning application for a loacl zoo and again won its case. Planning applications are all thoroughly perused and great interest is taken in all matters concerning the village. At present the Knockholt Society is fighting proposed provision of gypsy sites in the area.
